reporting-org.narrative: JINJA DISTRICT UNION OF PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES

title.narrative: Inclusion Works Project aims at increasing employment opportunities among men and women with disabilities in the formal sector.

description.narrative:
This quarterly Inspirational talk targeted 9 female job seekers with disabilities and was facilitated by 2 female role models visually impaired who provide encouragement and guidance. This was held at Iganga district union of persons with disabilities office on 13 December 2021.
The objective was to give a story of change to job seekers through sharing personal aspirations, divergences after acquisition of disability.
With this, the job seekers would be able to have personal growth, sense of purpose, change way of thinking, feeling and behaving, take action by seeing their disability from a new perspective within their communities and take on available job opportunities.

participating-org.narrative: JINJA DISTRICT UNION OF PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES

activity-date.narrative:
These female job seekers are identified through their respective Organizations of persons with disabilities to participate in the Inclusion Works project. They were enrolled on Accenture in November 2021 and identified to participate in a one day non residential meeting during the quarterly Inspirational Talk in December 2021.
The methodologies used were follow up through phone calls to confirm participation, Verbal presentation by role models, Open discussions, Questions and answer by all participants. In attendance were the Iganga District Union of Person with Disabilities Chairperson, Disability Inclusion Facilitator, Sign Language Interpreters and the Project Officer.
This activity is implemented on a rotational basis in the 2 districts of Jinja and Iganga which promotes exchange visits among the job seekers and uplifts the levels of their interaction.
The immediate outputs were to encourage women with disabilities who have qualifications to apply for job opportunities and actively participate in disability interventions; job seekers to have self -esteem, share learnings, achievements and challenges as female job seekers under the IW project so far on the open labour market.
